subject: Fwd: Dear Sir,
body:
Hello Paul,,
Thank you for your response, and I regret the little delay in getting back.
I am an intermediary representing the interest of the Ministry of
Agriculture officials who are in charge of procurements and contract
matters at the Ministry in Sierra Leone.   The scope of the proposed
collaboration with you is that we want you to be the overseas procurement
associate with the responsibility of liaising with the Tractor manufacturer
or dealer there in your country for facilitating the procurement and
shipment of the machines to the Ministry in Sierra Leone.

The Contract is for supply of a total of 150 units of agricultural Tractors
to be delivered within a period of 3 years.
The primary specifications for the Tractors required are:  1) Tractor 4 x 4
- (75 to 85 HP) with cabin (canopy) but no AC.  The brands popular here and
most acceptable are Massey Ferguson, John Deerer, Mahindra, Kubota.
However, any other durable and efficient brand suitable for the African
environment can be accepted.

The budget per unit is flexible, also note that something extra will be
added on the prices to be agreed with you - for the confidential benefit of
the Ministry of Agriculture officials. Method of payment is 100% in advance
after signing of the official Contract between you and the Sierra Leone
government under supervision of the Agric Ministry.

Please consider the above and get back with me, ASAP, also provide full
contact details.

Regards,
Mr. Tigori.




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Paul <tg43974@***.com>
Date: Thu, Feb 15, 2024 at 3:46â€¯AM
Subject: Re: Dear Sir,
To:





Hello Mr. Tigori,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this information with me. It sounds
like an interesting opportunity! I'm curious to know more about these
contracts. Could you please provide some more details? For instance, what
kind of tractors are we talking about? And what would be the nature of my
involvement in this?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.
Best wishes,
Paul

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Sir,
body:
Hello Mr. Tigori,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It sounds like a significant project that could have a great impact on the agricultural sector in Sierra Leone.

I'm interested to know more about my potential role as an overseas associate. Could you please elaborate on what my responsibilities would be? Also, I'm curious about the brands of tractors you mentioned - Massey Ferguson, John Deerer, Mahindra, Kubota. Are these the only acceptable brands or are there others that could be considered?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Paul

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Sir,
body:
Paul,

Thank you for confirming your interest, I hope and look forward to this
business bringing us into everlasting friendship and business relationship.

For your confidential information, one of the officials is a step-brother
to the current President of the country, Mr. Julius Bio.  So, please I wish
to emphasize the need for utmost confidentiality in your handling of the
affairs of this business, keep all details and information only to yourself
not to be shared with others.  I am asking this not for any illegality
reasons, but for obvious reasons to protect the names and private interests
of the officials involved.   As I mentioned in the previous message, deals
like this are one of the ways by which African officials use to secure
their financial future to take care of the rainy days after retiring from
government service.  In view of the poor salaries paid and recurring
depreciation in value of their national currencies.

Your primary role under this Foreign Vendor Outsourcing Contract for supply
of the agric Tractors, etc. will be as follows:

1)  Obtain initial (accurate or projected prices) of the agric
Tractors/implements;
2)  Submit an initial quotation for the equipment, for consideration by the
officials;
3)  Submit a Proforma Invoice (as you would be advised) after the initial
quotation has been checked and considered by the SL officials; the proforma
invoice will take care of the amount of money required to buy the machines,
arrange shipment to Port of Freetown, Sierra Leone, also extra money to be
added to the contract value by the officials for their private benefit;
4)  Sign the official Outsourcing Contract between you and the Sierra Leone
Ministry of Agriculture & Forestry - also, to be endorsed by their Ministry
of Finance;
5)  Receive payment to your account from the Bank of Sierra Leone or her
international payment agent - payment for almost the total value of the
Outsourcing Contract will be paid to you in advance, under the special
arrangement being made by the officials of the Ministry;
6)  After receiving payment (at least 85% advance), you handle the
logistics of procuring the Tractors from a suitable dealer, and thereafter
arrangements for shipment of the items to the destination Port in Sierra
Leone.

The role of the SL Ministry of Agriculture officials will be to use their
positions and offices to facilitate award of the Outsourcing Contract to
you/your company; also ensure that payment for total value of the Contract
is made as quickly as possible by bank wire (or any other means to be
agreed) to your account.  Also, monitor, supervise the whole transaction
and provide any assistance you may need for the logistics of shipment and
delivery of the items.

My role will remain as the middleman and intermediary between you and the
Sierra Leonean officials, also providing any other assistance that may be
needed.

For the agricultural Tractors, the primary acceptable brands are any  of
the following:  Massey Ferguson, John Deere, or Mahindra, however, other
Japanese (such as Kubota) or European (such as New Holland) quality brands
can be accepted.  Or let me know of any other brand(s) you can recommend
suitable for the African weather and environment.

Please acknowledge this email and your understanding of the above, also any
questions or clarifications you need, let  me know.
Regards,
Mr. Tigori.

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Sir,
body:
Hello Mr. Tigori,

Thank you for your detailed explanation of the business proposal. It sounds like a very interesting opportunity and I appreciate your trust in me to handle this task.

I understand that my role would be to obtain prices for agricultural tractors, submit quotations and invoices, sign contracts with the Sierra Leone Ministry of Forestry, receive payments, and handle logistics for procuring and shipping the tractors. 

However, I have a few questions before we proceed further:

1. Could you provide more details about the specific models or types of tractors needed? This will help me get accurate price quotes.
2. What is the expected timeline for this project? When do you anticipate needing the tractors delivered by?
3. How many tractors are required for this contract?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Paul

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Sir,
body:
Paul,

Sorry, please I have been a bit under the weather and was not at work today.
However, I am getting better now and will send a detailed response to your
previous email, between tonight and tomorrow morning.

Mr. Tigori.

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Sir,
body:
Hello Paul,

I hope this message finds you well. I'm sorry for the delay in my response, I've been feeling a bit under the weather and wasn't able to work today. 

However, I'm starting to feel better now and I promise to send a detailed response to your previous email between tonight and tomorrow morning.

By the way, could you please remind me of some of the key points we discussed? It would be really helpful for me to make sure that I address everything in my upcoming email.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best,
Mr.

Best wishes,
Paul

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Sir,
body:
Paul,
I do not understand the message in the email I just received from you
moments ago.

Mr. Tigori.

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Sir,
body:
Hello Mr. Tigori,

I hope this message finds you well. I'm sorry to hear that you're having trouble understanding the email I sent earlier. Could you please specify which part of the email is unclear? I'd be more than happy to provide further clarification.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Paul
